level.heading: Criminal enforcement by the District of Columbia.
level.text: Every person who violates section 28-4502 or 28-4503 shall be guilty of a misdemeanor, and, on conviction thereof, shall be punished by a fine of not more than the amount set forth in [§ 22-3571.01], or by imprisonment not exceeding one (1) year, or both. The Corporation Counsel shall commence and try all prosecutions for violations of section 28-4502 or 28-4503. Whenever a corporation violates section 28-4502 or 28-4503, the individual directors, officers, or agents of such corporation who have intentionally authorized, ordered or ratified the acts constituting such violation shall be punishable in accordance with this section.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 28-4510 and § 28-4511.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-317 substituted "of not more than the amount set forth in [§ 22-3571.01]" for "not exceeding $50,000").

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 285(e) of the Criminal Fine Proportionality Emergency Act of 2013 (D.C. Act 20-45, April 1, 2013, 60 DCR 5400, 20 DCSTAT 1300).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 3-169
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 3-169, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 28-4501.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Applicability of D.C. Law 19-317: Section 401 of D.C. Law 19-317 provided that the act shall apply only to offenses committed on or after June 11, 2013.
